front.title: Secret Key Transaction Authentication for DNS (TSIG)

abstract.t: This protocol allows for transaction level authentication using shared secrets and one way hashing. It can be used to authenticate dynamic updates as coming from an approved client, or to authenticate responses as coming from an approved name server. No provision has been made here for distributing the shared secrets. This document includes revised original TSIG specifications (RFC2845) and its extension for HMAC-SHA (RFC4635).
